title.narrative: Provision of Integrated Lifesaving Reproductive Health and GBV Prevention and Response Services for floods and crisis Affected Communities

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to scale up protection and sexual and reproductive health services to mitigate the adverse impact of a projected flood shock on the lives and livelihoods of vulnerable women, girls and other marginalized group in Unity State. This UNFPA project supports health facilities and mobile teams to deliver emergency obstetric and new-born care, family planning and other lifesaving reproductive health services for communities, distributes dignity kits and cash to the most vulnerable women and girls and provides other protection services such as gender-based violence case management and psychosocial support, among others. The project provides sexual and reproductive health services to 19,090 people, including 917 men, 9,540 women, 583 boys, 8,050 girls and 3,801 people with disabilities, and protection support to 17,750 people, including 2,102 men, 9,323 women, 931 boys, 5,394 girls and 1,774 people with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)
